Location: HYBRID HEARING - Council Chambers - City Hall

Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
INVOCATION - Delivered by Roderick Roberts, Sr., Senior Pastor, spiritual leader at Ramah Christian Center Inc., located at 3360 Fish Avenue, Bronx, NY 10469, Bronx, NY 10469.

Motion to spread the Invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Riley.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Bishop Roderick Roberts, Sr., Senior Pastor at Ramah Christian Center Inc., located at 3360 Fish Avenue, Bronx, N.Y. 10469.

Council Member Riley moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the record.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring housing developers that receive public financing to assume financial responsibility for repairs required within 10 years of construction
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Requiring housing developers that receive public financing to assume financial responsibility for repairs required within 10 years of construction.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring closed captioning to be enabled on televisions in places of public accommodation
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil and Human Rights
Items.MatterName: Requiring closed captioning to be enabled on televisions in places of public accommodation.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to removing public urination from the list of offenses diverted to the office of administrative trials and hearings, and to repeal paragraph b of subdivision 9 of section 16-118 of the administrative code of the city of New York, relating to the penalties for public urination
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Removing public urination from the list of offenses diverted to the office of administrative trials and hearings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing access to annual disclosure forms and repealing paragraph 2 of subdivision e of section 12-110 of such code relating to notification of requests to examine disclosure reports
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Increasing access to annual disclosure forms and repealing paragraph 2 of subdivision e of section 12-110 of such code relating to notification of requests to examine disclosure reports.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to allocation of resources for green infrastructure
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Allocation of resources for green infrastructure.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter and the New York city building code, in relation to requiring auxiliary radio communication systems in certain buildings in specific occupancy groups
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Requiring auxiliary radio communication systems in certain buildings in specific occupancy groups.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to establishing a charter revision commission to draft a new or revised city charter
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Establishing a charter revision commission to draft a new or revised city charter.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring that certain injured animals receive timely veterinary care
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Requiring that certain injured animals receive timely veterinary care.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing an inter-borough planning and advisory commission for the siting of active transportation parking hubs in the city
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
Items.MatterName: Establishing an inter-borough planning and advisory commission for the siting of active transportation parking hubs in the city.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring centralized siting of active transportation docking stations
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
Items.MatterName: Requiring centralized siting of active transportation docking stations.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to a report on costs to repair sidewalks damaged by city-owned trees
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
Items.MatterName: Report on costs to repair sidewalks damaged by city-owned trees.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to use of non-deadly physical force in self-defense by a peace officer or security guard at a shelter
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Use of non-deadly physical force in self-defense by a peace officer or security guard at a shelter.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to notification of changes to appropriations of capital projects funded by the council
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Notification of changes to appropriations of capital projects funded by the council.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign a law implementing a parking permit system for Park-and-Ride parking lots located in Staten Island.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
Items.MatterName: Implementing a parking permit system for Park-and-Ride parking lots located in Staten Island.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation that would require the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to provide free express bus fare to New York City students who take express buses to school.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Metropolitan Transportation Authority to provide free express bus fare to New York City students who take express buses to school.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of the Castle Hill business improvement district.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Establishment of the Castle Hill business improvement district.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, The New Deal for CUNY (S.4461-A/A.5843-A), which is intended to reestablish the City University of New York as an engine for social and economic mobility by waiving all tuition and creating certain staff-to-student ratios in order to increase student success.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Higher Education
Items.MatterName: The New Deal for CUNY (S.4461-A/A.5843-A)

Items.Title: Resolution concerning the establishment of the Castle Hill Business Improvement District in the Borough of the Bronx and setting the date, time and place for the public hearing to hear all persons interested in the establishment of such district.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Establishment of the Castle Hill business improvement district.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring information about elections for non-municipal offices, ballot proposals and referenda in the voter guide
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Requiring information about elections for non-municipal offices, ballot proposals and referenda in the voter guide.

Items.Title: Resolution reaffirming New York Cityâ€™s status as a Purple Heart City and calling on the State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign A.7961/S.2279, designating the State of New York a Purple Heart State.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Veterans
Items.MatterName: Designating the State of New York a Purple Heart State. (A.7961/S.2279)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to temporary absence procedures for citywide public officials
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Temporary absence procedures for citywide public officials.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring towing companies to remove debris from the scene of an accident
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer and Worker Protection
Items.MatterName: Requiring towing companies to remove debris from the scene of an accident.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring that the department of transportation maintain curb heights following street construction
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
Items.MatterName: Requiring that the DOT maintain curb heights following street construction.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the welfare of shelter animals, and to repeal section 17-820 of such administrative code upon the expiration thereof
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: The welfare of shelter animals, and to repeal section 17-820 of such administrative code upon the expiration thereof.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to restricting the parking of certain commercial vehicles in residential streets overnight
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
Items.MatterName: Restricting the parking of certain commercial vehicles in residential streets overnight.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass and governor to sign, A.6087/S.3741, which would amend the New York State Penal Law to establish the offenses of reckless endangerment of an emergency service person in the first degree and second degree when individuals knowingly alter or convert a building that impedes egress and results in the injury or death of emergency service personnel
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Establish the offenses of reckless endangerment of an emergency service person in the first degree and second degree. (A.6087/S.3741)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, A.337 and A.2091/S.1934, to require prescribing physicians to perform additional actions, such as counseling the patient on the risks of addiction and overdose, when prescribing certain opioids.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Require prescribing physicians to perform additional actions, such as counseling the patient on the risks of addiction and overdose, when prescribing certain opioids. (A.337 and A.2091/S.1934)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.5374-A/A.6329-A, the Fair Pay for Home Care Act.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Fair Pay for Home Care Act. (S.5374-A/A.6329-A)

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Youth Services
Items.MatterName: Financial literacy education in department of youth and community development programs.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to posting information on school meal ingredients and preparation online and reporting on allergic reactions to school meals
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Posting information on school meal ingredients and preparation online and reporting on allergic reactions to school meals.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of a task force to develop equitable responses to infectious disease related emergencies, including COVID-19
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Establishment of a task force to develop equitable responses to infectious disease related emergencies, including COVID-19.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to signage regarding transgender rights and services at hospitals
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Signage regarding transgender rights and services at hospitals.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to report on training for medical care for transgender and gender non-conforming persons
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Requiring the dept of health and mental hygiene to report on training for medical care for transgender and gender non-conforming persons.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on Congress to pass, and the President to sign, legislation that allows service members, veterans and eligible surviving spouses to use the United States Department of Veteran Affairs home loans to purchase cooperative apartments.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Veterans
Items.MatterName: Legislation that allows service members, veterans and eligible surviving spouses to use the US Department of Veteran Affairs home loans to purchase cooperative apartments.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.4015, which would amend the education law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to authorizing the chancellor of the city district to control and operate certain specialized high schools in the city of New York and to establish a commission on middle school achievement, and providing for the repeal of certain provisions upon the expiration thereof
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Authorizing the chancellor of the city district to control and operate certain specialized high schools in the city of NY and to establish a commission on middle school achievement. (S. 4015)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, A. 5115B/S. 5819C, in relation to enacting the New York Collegiate Athletic Participation Compensation Act to allow student-athletes to receive compensation, including for the use of a studentâ€™s name, image or likeness.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Higher Education
Items.MatterName: Enacting the New York Collegiate Athletic Participation Compensation Act. (A. 5115B/S. 5819C)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign legislation barring prison labor contracting statewide.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Criminal Justice
Items.MatterName: Barring prison labor contracting statewide.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Department of Education and the New York State Education Department to meet their obligations under state and federal law to provide impartial due process hearings in a timely manner as they relate to resolving complaints filed by families of students with disabilities.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Mental Health, Disabilities and Addiction
Items.MatterName: NYC DOE and the NYS Education Dept to meet their obligations under state and federal law to provide impartial due process hearings in a timely manner as they relate to resolving complaints filed by families of students with disabilities.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to amend and pass A. 441, and the Governor to sign the amended legislation, in relation to non-preferential opportunity for use of amenities in certain buildings and apartments.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Non-preferential opportunity for use of amenities in certain buildings and apartments. (A.411)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Commissioner of Major League Baseball to strip the Houston Astros and the Boston Red Sox of their respective 2017 and 2018 World Series titles.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Commissioner of Major League Baseball to strip the Houston Astros and the Boston Red Sox of their respective 2017 and 2018 World Series titles.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, A. 1928/S. 820, which would amend the New York State Constitution to realign budgetary power by granting the Legislature a more equal role with the Governor in shaping the state budget.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Realign budgetary power by granting the Legislature a more equal role with the Governor in shaping the state budget.. (A. 1928/S. 820)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Department of Correction to increase the wage rates of incarcerated individuals to the New York State minimum wage rate of $15 per hour.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Criminal Justice
Items.MatterName: Dept of Correction to increase the wage rates of incarcerated individuals to the NYS minimum wage rate of $15 per hour.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation requiring all New York City Community District Education Councils to adopt a set of bylaws and a code of conduct that includes disciplinary consequences for discriminatory actions and use of discriminatory language.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Requiring all NYC Community District Education Councils to adopt a set of bylaws and a code of conduct that includes disciplinary consequences for discriminatory actions and use of discriminatory language.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign, legislation mandating that any owner intending to sell a multi-unit residential dwelling, must first make a fairly appraised offer of sale to the tenants within the residence before making any sale offers to third parties.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Mandating that any owner intending to sell a multi-unit residential dwelling, must first make a fairly appraised offer of sale to the tenants within the residence before making any sale offers to third parties.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the Department of Corrections and Community Supervision to open its law library during states of emergency and pandemics with safety protocols in place.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Criminal Justice
Items.MatterName: Dept of Corrections and Community Supervision to open its law library during states of emergency and pandemics with safety protocols in place.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation certifying that school employees of the Department of Education, including but not limited to principals, teachers and administrators, will not be discharged or penalized in retaliation for disclosing information regarding an activity, policy, or practices that pose a substantial and specific threat to public health or safety within their working environment.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Certifying that school employees of the DOE, including but not limited to principals, teachers and administrators, will not be discharged or penalized in retaliation for disclosing information regarding an activity, policy, or practices.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Office of Children and Family Services to prohibit juvenile justice agencies from using room confinement as a form of restraint in secure detention facilities and from using transitional hold as a form of restraint in detention and placement facilities.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: NYS Office of Children and Family Services to prohibit juvenile justice agencies from using room confinement as a form of restraint in secure detention facilities.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the New York State Governor to sign, S. 1828 /A. 3103, which would eliminate the subminimum wage for employees based on their disability or age.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Eliminate the subminimum wage for employees based on their disability or age. (S. 1828 /A. 3103)

Items.Title: Application No. C 220131 PSM (NEW PROVIDENCE REDEVELOPMENT - 225 EAST 45TH STREET) submitted by the Department of Housing Preservation and Development (HPD) and the Department of Homeless Services (DHS), pursuant to Section 197-c of the New York City Charter, modifying the restriction limiting the capacity of the shelter facility located at 215-225 East 45th Street (Block 1319, Lots 8 and 11), Borough of Manhattan, Community District 6, Council District 4.

Items.MinutesNote: The Majority Leader (Council Member Powers) presiding as the President Pro Tempore.
The presence of a quorum was announced by the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers).

The Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motion which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

At this point, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) declared that the aforementioned items were adopted and referred to the Committee on Land Use and to the appropriate Land Use Subcommittee.
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Adams) made the following announcements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Adams), the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Powers) adjourned these proceedings to meet again for the Stated Meeting of Thursday, March 10, 2022.

MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council
